name: commando
description: The VSCode extension that simply runs commands.

commando.autoClear.description: If true, automatically clear the output channel or terminal after each command.

commando.autoFocus.description: If true, automatically focus the output channel or terminal after each command.

commando.runOnTerminal.description: If true, run commands on terminal. Otherwise, run commands on background and show the result in output channel.

commando.windowName.description: The name of the output channel or terminal. You can use predefined variables.

commando.shell.description: The shell to use for running commands. If empty, the default shell is used. This setting is only available when runOnTerminal is false.

commando.commands.description: The list of commands to run.

name.description: The name of the command. This is used to identify the command. This must be unique.

autoClear.description: If ture, automatically clear the output channel or terminal after each command. If null, use the value of commando.autoClear.

autoFocus.description: If true, automatically focus the output channel or terminal after each command. If null, use the value of commando.autoFocus.

runOnTerminal.description: If true, run commands on terminal. Otherwise, run commands on background and show the result in output channel. If null, use the value of commando.runOnTerminal.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
